snippet: A federal court ruling may halt the spread of municipal high-speed internet providers, which often serve households and businesses where commercial cable and telecom firms have been unwilling to go....
abstract: Wilson Journal; residents of Wilson, NC, worry recent decision by United States Court of Appeals will cause them to lose their city-provided high-speed Internet service; analysts say decision by North Carolina state legislators to favor traditional cable and telecom carriers over federally-supported  municipal broadband networks will threaten future of of communications in rural areas, squash competition, raise prices and widen digital divide.
lead_paragraph: A federal court ruling may halt the spread of municipal high-speed internet providers, which often serve households and businesses where commercial cable and telecom firms have been unwilling to go.

headline.main: Broadband Law Could Force Rural Residents Off Information Superhighway
